data.title: insertSnippet refinemenets
data.body:
~~We now have `TextEditor#edit(SnippetString)` and we should make that into `TextEditor#edit(string | SnippetString)`~~

- [x] Instead of polishing the overload we will remove the overload and just make it `insertSnippet` to make it's purpose very clear.
- [x] we will also ask to provide a range at which the snippet is to be implemented

data.title: security.workspacesTrustedToSpecifyExecutables setting: wording
data.body:
```
// Specifes which workspaces are trusted to specify executables in their settings. 
//  This option can only configured in the user settings.
  "security.workspacesTrustedToSpecifyExecutables": {},
```
Should be:
This option can only **be** configured in the user settings.

data.title: Review `security.workspacesTrustedToSpecifyExecutables` setting
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/22238238/b3382140-e210-11e6-8150-1f44e0dc595e.png)

Related to #19112

This setting is:

1. Way too ambiguous.
2. Lost when I rename my workspace.
3. Not shareable between machines.

It needs some serious review.

data.title: Typescript: "This workspace specifies executables."
data.body:
I just got the latest version opened in our repo and the following popup came up:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/22238198/70071bf6-e210-11e6-896d-4d7c576245d8.png)

I had no idea where it came from or why it was happening. Only after having opened the settings I found similar language, so I deduced this must be TypeScript.

The message is at best very ambiguous. It doesn't even mention what feature it belongs to.

cc @dbaeumer

data.title: Test: Welcome UX
data.body:
Testing #18091

Complexity: 3

Would be great if at least 2 people from ZRH could test, Redmond has done a test pass last week.

- [x] Windows @waderyan
- [x] Mac @weinand 
- [x] Linux @bpasero 

Test:
- Enable the Welcome UX with the setting: `"telemetry.experiments.enableWelcomePage": true`
- Restart
- Verify there is Help > Welcome
- Verify the Welcome page opens automatically at startup unless any file is opened as part of the startup or the setting "workbench.welcome.enabled" is set to false
- Test the Welcome page
- Test the Interface Overview
- Test the Interactive Playground
- Test both functionality and design / layout

data.title: Test: Chrome extension
data.body:
We have never done a bug bash/testplan-item for the Chrome extension, so I'd really appreciate someone taking a few minutes to look at it.

Complexity: 3

- [x] Any OS @joaomoreno 
- [x] Any OS @isidorn 

I'm especially interested in the experience of getting started. Grab a web project that you have sitting around, or clone some random hello world project, and see if you can debug it with the extension, with sourcemaps and everything working. Or you can look at the [other debug testplan-items for this sprint](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20label%3Atestplan-item%20label%3Adebug), especially #19096.

Use this vsix for testing: 
[debugger-for-chrome-2.4.3.vsix.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/725800/debugger-for-chrome-2.4.3.vsix.zip)

data.title: Safe handling of workspace executables
data.body: Ensure workspace defined executables need user confirmation.

data.title: HTML indentation bug when using inline styles
data.body: Any tags that follow a tag using inline styles will not have the property indentation -- they will be to the far left. - VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: macOS Sierra Steps to Reproduce: 1. The following html was formatted using the keyboard shortcut. Notice that all elements have the appropriate indentation. 2. Now, I'll just make one change: on the third `div` with a class of `foo`, I'll add an inline style. Afterward, I'll format again using the keyboard shortcut. Notice that the proper indentation is not preserved on tags (including closing tags) that follow the inline style.

data.title: Allow developers to bind to any keypress

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
IntelliJ have this extension called [Presentation Assistant](https://github.com/JetBrains/resharper-presentation-assistant) that displays the keys pressed.

This will help during presentation/pair programming.

AFAIK, currently vscode only have provision to bind to a given key combination. In order to implement an extension of this sort, we need extension point for plugins to hook into any keypress.

It would be better to allow users to hook into mouse activity aswell. I'm not sure about the usecase, but someone might comeup with a usecase :)

data.title: Mac: After update of VS Code, app wont start - endless error loop.
data.body:
Greetings.

I had VS Code working fine on Mac.
On starting today it informed me of update, it also advised me to install one of the top rated  python parsers - I allowed it to go ahead.
Download is of: 'VSCode-darwin-stable', file size 53.5mb.
After install, it asked for a restart of the app.
I allowed this.
On restart, it gave an error dialog - both dialog options, on clicking, result in the application simply crashing out. [See this tweet for screenshot](https://twitter.com/ajsondev/status/823472623661117441)
I have tried uninstalling/reinstalling - same thing happens.
I assume therefore that there is some left over config/settings somewhere that need to be cleaned out to allow it to start cleanly again ... can you direct you direct to where this can be done?

cheers.

data.title: Rename TypeDefinitionProvider to TypeImplementationProvider
data.body:
Fixes #19099


**bug**
In #18346, I originally called the new `go to implementation` provider api `ImplementationProvider` which was a terrible name, so we then decided to rename the API to `TypeDefinitionProvider`. At the time, I didn't realize that a `type definition` was actually its own, unrelated concept.

**Fix**
Rename `TypeDefinitionProvider` to `TypeImplementationProvider` to make it clear what the purpose and use of this API is.

data.title: some things like "clear" and  "screen" are now broken in terminal
data.body:
```
bob@devweb1 dmanetwork (master) $ screen -r
Cannot find terminfo entry for 'cmd.exe'.
```
```
bob@devweb1 dmanetwork (master) $ clear
'cmd.exe': unknown terminal type.
```

windows 10, code 1.9.0-insider, cmd.exe > `ssh dev` (ubuntu 14.04)

these used to work, a few insiders builds ago. i do the screen all the time to check in on a long running rsync. let me know what kind of debugging info you may need.

i feel like this happen at the same time that powershell became the default. probably not relevant for anything except carbon dating the issue.

data.title: Test: Search results navigation
data.body:
Test for #17324 
Complexity: 1

- [x] Any OS @joaomoreno
- [x] Any OS @mousetraps 

Test that 
- When you use the up/down arrow keys in the search results pane, the selected result is opened in the editor. Note that this is rate-limited to avoid running the CPU too much when navigating quickly.
- You can use F4/Shift+F4 to navigate search results. This will put the cursor focus in the editor. Note that if you have the C++ extension installed, it will take over the F4 keybinding - they are changing this.

data.title: Add Setting to Disable Double Click in Markdown Preview to switch to editor
Markdown Scroll Sync Perf Improvements
data.body:
A few perf improvements could be made for the markdown scroll synchronization implementation. I have not noticed any major problems, even with long documents, but slower machines may start being impacted by these

- [X] Throttle sync events
- [ ] Cache list of line elements and their position on the page
- [ ] Binary search to find the closest elements instead of linear search

data.title: Test: Reindent all lines
data.body:
Test for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/18958

- [ ] any os @pjmeyer 
- [x] any os @aeschli 

Complexity: 3

Things to note:

* We don't set any keybindings for this command, please run it from command palette
* This command doesn't support multiple languages in one single file right now.
* Make sure the file you are working on has indentation rules set, like TypeScript or Ruby.

data.title: Test: Local Links in the Markdown Preview
data.body:
OS
- [x] any @stevencl 
- [x] any @sandy081 

Complexity: 1

1. Create a new project with an blank `test.md` file and a `main.md` file with 
```
[work](/test.md)

[rel](./test.md) 

[loc](test.md)
```
1. Preview the markdown file.
1. Click each link.
     - ⭐Each link should open `test.md` in the editor
1. Change one of the links to a file that does not exist.
1. Preview the markdown again and click on the bad link.
     - ⭐You should see an error message about `Unable to open ...`

data.title: Test: Markdown Editor Document Link Provider
data.body:
OS
- [x] Windows @dbaeumer 
- [x] any @mousetraps 

Complexity: 1

1. Clone and open the VSCode-docs repo: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs
1. Open a markdown file.
1. Look for a link of the format `[link text](path/file.ext)`
1. Hover over the `path/file.ext` part of the link.
     - ⭐A blue underline should appear under the link along with a message about ctrl-clicking the link
1. Try ctrl clicking the link
     - ⭐If the link is a local link, it should open that file in the editor. Links of the form `./path` or `path` should resolve to a path relative to the current file. Links of the form `/path` should resolve relative to the current workspace

data.title: Test: TS References Code Lens
data.body:
OS
- [x] any @joaomoreno
- [x] any @stevencl 

Complexity 1:

1. Open the vscode codebase in the editor
1. Add the setting `"typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled": true`
1. Open a TS file
1. Check that reference counts are displayed on classes and interfaces, as well as on methods/properties in those methods and interfaces. Check that the reference counts look correct 
1. Click on some of the references. It should open a peek that shows a list of references. 
1. Check that clicking through some of the references in the peek, jump to the reference location
